intro: Pseudopteryxia hendersonii, commonly known as the Henderson's pteryllia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pseudopteryxia hendersonii is considered a vulnerable species.
